page.title: 11Mackerye End Harpenden
page.content:
Mr & Mrs Cory-Wright live at Mackerye End. They've lived there since 1951. The house was built by John Brockett in the 1600's. There are seventeen rooms in the house. The house uses a well instead of proper water mains. There are two tulip trees in the front garden one of them was struck by lightning in the 1700's. The Cory- Wrights replaced the tree when they moved in.
There is a bell tower on the roof which was used to bring the farm workers in from the fields. In the back garden is a ginka tree which is rare in Britain. It has delicate fan-shaped leaves.
Mackerye End is a pleasant house and most of the owners have lived to a right old age.
